body:
It is not tox problem.

I run command directly in gitlab runner but I cant load setting correctly

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17740390/204519936-a4fa78ca-2baf-412d-a038-df3f9aac6d85.png)

Hi @fly50789. It seems that you need to use `[pylint.main]` instead of `[MESSAGES CONTROL]` inside an `ini` file for this to work. [Source code](https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/blob/main/pylint/config/config_file_parser.py#L45).

From that code block:
_The use of 'MASTER' or 'master' as configuration section for pylint 
 has been deprecated, as it's bad practice to not start sections titles with the
tool name. Please use 'pylint.main' instead.,_

I've tried a quick test with your `tox` command & it works for me.

There is a [section in the documentation ](https://pylint.pycqa.org/en/latest/user_guide/usage/run.html#command-line-options) describing the various ways of passing a configuration file; so perhaps the fix here is to add a line beneath the `pyproject.toml` section for `tox.ini`.

Would you like to contribute a MR @fly50789?
@mbyrnepr2    Sorry English is not my mother tongue, What is MR meaning?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17740390/204695326-d64aabb9-9e2d-4450-a14a-fea2769ad198.png)

It run perfectly!! Thank for your help.

I know setting file can be set in different file.

But tox is a useful tool to mange different test ,so I prefer to make all tool config in single file which is `tox.ini`.

Ps. is any way to overwrite setting of rcfile  by command like

`pylint --rcfile=tox.ini <extra-command-to-overwrite> <path>`

> @mbyrnepr2 Sorry English is not my mother tongue, What is MR meaning?

Sorry, I should have been clearer. I wanted to check if you are interested in creating a Merge Request to fix the documentation? Otherwise someone else can pick it up.

> Ps. is any way to overwrite setting of rcfile by command like
> 
> `pylint --rcfile=tox.ini <extra-command-to-overwrite> <path>`

Sure, something like this:
`pylint --rcfile=tox.ini --enable=missing-class-docstring,missing-module-docstring <path>`

@mbyrnepr2 

I have interest to do this.

But  I never maintain the procedure of merge request in github.

I only use gitlab to develope my tool.

You might need to tell me more how to do.

Which part I need to write and merge to document?

Folk the project and fix document then assign to you..etc.

First I need to know how to trace the issue.

Even you refer me, I cant receive notification like below.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17740390/204750170-9865b970-1124-4e1d-983e-66142c71eb26.png)

Thank you for being willing to contribute @fly50789 I assigned you to the issue :) 

For this one you can probably modify only the doc (https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/tree/main/doc) from the github interface without installing the full env. If you open a Pull request in github then a pipeline will run and you'll be able to check the result on readthedoc directly.

@mbyrnepr2
I have verify that  I have authority to overwirte the doc.

I want to ask more detail.

1. which file and which part you want me to change?

I already try to pull request
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17740390/204955815-5c50a4bd-75e7-4f8e-a596-a0336f6b0724.png)

2. the `readthedoc`  you mean I can see the result in [this web site](https://pylint.pycqa.org/en/latest/#)?
